text: I think once there seems to be uh an
approach where the domestic
responsibilities are the responsibility
of the women in a home and that
handicaps a woman is because then she
has to really live two
lives uh the second is it is expected
that women transfer with their husbands
when their husbands are successful and
move from place to place which again
disrupts her career particularly if her
organization is not
multinational or not having multiple
centers within the same
country and three it's uh it's a factor
of the fact
that she she just she's not putting in
that kind of ambition naturally through
social pressures which a man is expected
to put in through social
pressures positive discrimination in
favor of women more intense training of
women for leadership positions and
inducting into the organization
laterally when you have not built it
enough organically to cut short
time and three or four is to give
flexibility to women to work in more
flexible work hours including some work
from home our experience is very
positive they have a rare sense of
sensitivity they have a higher sense of
loyalty and uh they can be very very
successful and pointed and firm when
they need to be so so our experience is
very positive we are biasing things
towards women in terms of the population
of our company about 38% are
women and we have a high concentration
of engineers in the company 60% of the
people in our company are Engineers so
you can see it's very unusual because
the engineering graduates of women is
much less than the male graduates of
women so we have actually biased much
more in terms of what we select from
